title: What would the Fed be like under Chair Janet Yellen?
teaser: And how is Wall Street reacting to the White House's announcement?
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Wednesday, October 9, 2013
contenttemplated:
[{"type":"text/html","content":"

Janet Yellin has been on the shortlist to replace Ben Bernanke as chair of the Federal Reserve since long before former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers dropped out of contention over the summer.  Gus Faucher, senior economist at PNC Financial Services Group, talks about what monetary policy is likely to be under a Yellen Fed, and tells Marketplace Morning Report host David Brancaccio how Wall Street is reacting to her nomination.

"}]
description: And how is Wall Street reacting to the White House's announcement?
contentencoded: Janet Yellin has been on the shortlist to replace Ben Bernanke as chair of the Federal Reserve since long before former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers dropped out of contention over the summer.  Gus Faucher, senior economist at PNC Financial Services Group, talks about what monetary policy is likely to be under a Yellen Fed, and tells Marketplace Morning Report host David Brancaccio how Wall Street is reacting to her nomination.
